thread.title: 5 boys in stolen car go to St. Louis police station for help after one is shot
thread.title_full: 5 boys in stolen car go to St. Louis police station for help after one is shot

author: From staff reports
title: 5 boys in stolen car go to St. Louis police station for help after one is shot

organizations.name: north patrol division on union boulevard

text:
Buy Now 
A crime unit technician gathers evidence in the parking lot of the police North Patrol Division at 4014 North Union Boulevard on Monday, Feb. 6, 2017. A group of teens in a stolen car drove to the police station after one of the teens was shot. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, 5 boys in stolen car go to St. Louis police station for help after one is shot From staff reports Buy Now 
A crime unit technician gathers evidence in the parking lot of the police North Patrol Division at 4014 North Union Boulevard on Monday, Feb. 6, 2017. A group of teens in a stolen car drove to the police station after one of the teens was shot. Photo by Laurie Skrivan, lskrivan@post-dispatch.com 
ST. LOUIS â€¢ Five teenage boys in a stolen car went to a St. Louis police station Monday afternoon after someone shot at them, injuring a 16-year-old. 
The teen was hit in the back. He was taken to a hospital for treatment after the boys drove to the North Patrol Division on Union Boulevard about 4 p.m. for help. Police said he was stable. 
He was in a car with four other boys, ages 13-15, when someone in another car shot at them in the 6000 block of Delmar Boulevard, police said. The shooter chased the car full of teens as they fled to the North Patrol Division at 4014 North Union. 
After getting help for the injured teen, police discovered the car the boys were in had been reported stolen. The teens were booked for tampering, police said. 
Authorities had no description of the shooter. The investigation is ongoing.
